course.subject: ISOM
course.name: Logistics Management
course.description: Management of purchasing and distribution of goods and services; supply management; material handling; pricing; transportation and warehousing; customer service standards. Second or third year standing preferred.

reviews.author: ymang
reviews.comment_content: Lots of content with a new topic in every lecture. Recommend keeping upto date with topics as you go along, otherwise gets difficult to keep track and do the in class activities.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching is decent but a lot of things are not explained. Since there is no textbook, some things have to be self taught. Content is taught through lecture videos and is not really effective for learning.
reviews.comment_grading:
Same weighting for final and midterm (25% each)
25% for group project.
Rest is in class discussions, participation and homework problems.
reviews.comment_workload: Heavy workload for a 3 credit course. Class attendance required on certain days for in class activities and need to watch 2 lecture videos every week on separate topics. Video watching can be quite time consuming.

reviews.author: yiujaiii
reviews.comment_content: Most of the content is taught in previous OM course. It should be quite easy. Do not require a lot of calculation. But I don't know what I have learned about logistics management.
reviews.comment_teaching: Hardly understand what he is talking about. Do not talk about main point. Mainly taught by lecture video so do not need to attend a lot of lectures which is more flexible in time and less demanding.
reviews.comment_grading: Normal. Quite a portion related to group project which the guideline is very unclear.
reviews.comment_workload: No homework. But have project which require two presentations.

reviews.author: chocolate lover
reviews.title: Depends on your expectation
reviews.comment_content:
Some are quite similar to previous OM course e.g. EOQ and newsvendor.
Other new content would be inventory planning, TSP and VRP heuristics, purchasing and pricing.

Final exam is cumulative.
reviews.comment_teaching: Sometimes didn't answer what we are asking. The lecture notes do not include everything he said in class so pay attention to class.
reviews.comment_grading:
Class Participation: 10%
In-class exercise: 10%
Midterm: 20%
HW: 15%
Final: 25%
Final Project: 20%

Class Participation counts by IPRS. Although he didn't count attendance, if you do not attend the class and miss the in-class IPRS, you will miss the participation points. Full marks will be given if you answer correctly for each question, 50% for answering a wrong answer, and 0% for unsuccessful submission. Even you don't the correct answers you can still 50%.

In-class exercise for 3-4 times without prior notification. Questions are not difficult, but related to the content that you have just learnt, so pay attention to class. Always attend the lesson with phone that the exercises need to be scanned and upload to Canvas in pdf format within 20 minutes.

HW in group format, not so challenging.

Final project: have to find a company that you can apply the course materials to improve the company performance. Only have to submit a proposals and presentation PPT.
**Need to search the company that provide you real data to get more points

I am quite poor at in-class exercise and class parti that only got around 77% for both of them. Almost full marks for HW.
My midterm is around mean but below median, final got +0.47 SD and above median 2 marks.
Final grade B+.
reviews.comment_workload:
Not much.
Listen carefully during class for the inclass exercise and revise the materials before the class would be enough.

HW is similar to inclass exercises and class materials so not so demading.

Final Project needs more time to search an appropriate company.

reviews.author: Jenyyyyyy
reviews.title: Online
reviews.comment_content: This course overall is not difficult and includes basic knowledge of the logistics industry and some calculations in which some of them have been covered in ISOM3700.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The powerpoint is clear and you need to attend lessons or ask your friends in order to fill in the missing parts and calculations in some of the slides. She illustrates the concepts with examples which makes them easier for students to understand.
She is willing to answer your questions in class and replies very soon when you email her.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is fair.
Term Project 40%
Comprehensive Final Exam 40%
It is unknown but you can email prof to ask her.
Case Studies 20%
The mean is high which is 9.xx/10 but it is not difficult to get high mark.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is quite heavy.
At the beginning of the semester, you need to form group through Canvas on your own and then hand in at least 2 case study which is no more than 3 pages. Case and related questions would be given in advance. After you hand in the first one (around add-drop period), you would already need to start another case study immediately if you want to have more time to prepare and discuss it with your groupmates.
After that, you would need to start the term project. You can decide your own topic which is very flexible and hand in the project proposal. You can do the whole project on your own pace as prof does not require any updates or intermediate report. Initially, prof required us to do the presentation in class at the end of the semester, but she changed it to at most 20min presentation video. You also need to hand in 10-25 pages final report after the final exam.
For the final exam, it is open-book and 2 hours long which is not enough to complete the whole exam. It has 2 parts that require you to explain some concepts and do the calculations. It is super long and has almost 20 questions. The questions about concepts are easy but require a lot of time for you to write down the answers on paper. For the calculation, some of them are easy and just need to follow the example on powerpoint and substitute correct value given by the questions, although it still requires a lot of time for you to copy the format and write down the formula. The last few questions are difficult so you should spare more time to complete them.

reviews.author: JHO
reviews.comment_content: Prof比左好多心機去整個PowerPoint, 所以內容算幾豐富
reviews.comment_teaching: 佢有大陸英文口音，但未至於聽唔明。lecture唔洗take attendance ，所以我無咩點上堂，唔知佢教得好唔好
reviews.comment_grading:
Arrow case: 9.75/10
ACT case: 9.25/10
Project 同exam唔知幾分
但final A
reviews.comment_workload: 算大workload 要做2個case study 同1個group project, 重要個mean好高，所以要確保全對。不過無midterm

reviews.author: 好肚餓好肚餓
reviews.comment_content: ISOM 2700 learnt some of the stuff already and the rest is just super easy stuff about logistics. I would say the first half of the course is harder than the second half which is weird.
reviews.comment_teaching: Hard to understand teaching, the accent is too hard to understand, there are lecture videos for u to loop though. Overall, the teaching is still okay in lesson, he tries to explain clearly and makes lessons seem fun.
reviews.comment_grading: good grade simply because the tests are not really difficult and also he gives out participation cards so answer more questions
reviews.comment_workload: a group project and some questions to answer after watching lecture videos and in class exercises

reviews.author: Jackie0925
reviews.title: Good Grading Course
reviews.comment_content:
lots of contents overlap with ISOM 2700, eg. EOQ, ROP and newsvendor

the new contents are facility location, VRP&RSP and revenue management

I don't think I can learn much from this class
reviews.comment_teaching:
this course uses blended learning mode

there are videos talking about the class content; however, some of the class contents are presented unclearly that make us feel confused

the class time is mainly used for class activities and presentation
reviews.comment_grading:
Generous grading: mean around B/B+

the grading scheme is as follow:
Class Participation 5% --> get 5 participation cards to earn full credits
Homework 5% --> very easy to score full mark
In-class exercises (group) 15% --> solving problems in groups
Quiz (Midterm) 25% --> one cheatsheet allowed (19 MCs with one long question about inventory diagram)
Final 25% --> one cheatsheet allowed (25 MCs)
Project (group) 25% --> there are two parts, with two presentations

In my opinion, the main component of your grade is the exams
reviews.comment_workload:
the workload is fine
the heaviest workload is making the cheatsheets imo

reviews.author: IT
reviews.comment_content: There are ~12 topics. Quite simple to understand. Some overlap with ISOM 2700 content to help us revise.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor is very nice, and enthusiastic in teaching.
She is keen to answer any questions, she normally replies email very quickly.
reviews.comment_grading:
Good Grade.
Score above mean for all 3 case.
Project should be quite good.
One final, 1 sd above mean.
Final grade: A
reviews.comment_workload:
3 cases and a project plus final examination.
Students can volunteer to present for the case, and will be awarded extra marks. Worth a try as professor is quite lenient.
Quite heavy workload in the beginning,because the 3 cases are quite packed.

reviews.author: chanpo922
reviews.comment_content: Course content is simple, mainly general idea of logistic planning and changing in logistic.
reviews.comment_teaching: Man Yu is very nice professor. But lessons is little bored. The content is pretty well organised and easy to understand.
reviews.comment_grading: 3 cases, almost every group got nearly full marks out of 10. The project and final exam is the most important part. Cheat sheet is allowed in final exam. Project near 9/10 and final exam ~90%. Final grade A+
reviews.comment_workload: 3 group cases and 1 project. Students can volunteer to present for the cases, which will have extra marks for cases. Very subtle extra marks but require a lot effort to finish around 30 minutes presentations. no midterm only final. Generally not much work load

reviews.author: ansonfc
reviews.comment_content: Simple content, some of them are from ISOM2700.
reviews.comment_teaching: Just present the slides in class. Teaching tone and style is a bit boring.
reviews.comment_grading: Since the content of the course is quite simple, the curve of this class is quite high. Be aware what he say in class, coz the quiz content are not all from the slides but what he say in class. I suggest to find more exercise in web and do some research for the topic, for better understanding and grading.
reviews.comment_workload: You can watch lecture video, basically only one class per week, he will tell you which week need to attend both classes. 1 quiz 1 exam.
